subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Son is the radiance of God's glory and the exact representation of His being, sustaining all things by His powerful Word. After He had provided purification for sins, He sat down at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven. (Hebrews 1:3) NIV
reflection: I think we would all agree that here again we see the mystery of God's love revealed. The book of Hebrews links God's saving power with His creative power. In other words, the power that brought the universe into being and that keeps it operating is the very power that cleanses our sins. How mistaken we would be to ever think that God couldn't forgive us. No sin is the big for the Ruler of the universe to handle. He can and will forgive us when we come to Him through His Son. Through His Love we witness grace upon grace. My you truly experience the Mystery of His love for you. .
prayer: Christmas changes everything. It did 2000 years ago when the Word first became flesh, and it does each year--if we open ourselves to the mystery, the longing and the power of that event in the Bethlehem stable. Oh Lord make me sensitive once again as in the days of my childhood to the Mystery of You Love. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING~~~~& Merry Christmas

Our Devotion for Today:

The Son is the radiance of God's glory and the exact representation
of His being, sustaining all things by His powerful Word. After He had
provided purification for sins, He sat down at the right hand of the 
Majesty in heaven...(Heb. 1:3) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

I think we would all agree that here again we see the mystery of God's love 
revealed. The book of Hebrews links God's saving power with His creative 
power... In other words, the power that brought the universe into being and 
that keeps it operating is the very power that cleanses our sins...

How mistaken we would be to ever think that God couldn't forgive us. No sin
is the big for the Ruler of the universe to handle. He can and will forgive us 
when we come to Him through His Son...

Through His Love we witness grace upon grace...My you truly experience the 
Mystery of His love for you..

Our Prayer for Today:

Christmas changes everything. It did 2000 years ago when the Word 
first became flesh, and it does each year--if we open ourselves to the
mystery, the longing and the power of that event in the Bethlehem stable.
Oh Lord make me sensitive once again as in the days of my childhood
to the Mystery of You Love...Amen.

Keep Looking Up, prepare to celebrate His return...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

I'm so thankful to have e-mail once again after five weeks with-out...
Have a blessed Christmas...













.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He also says, "In the beginning, O Lord, You laid the foundations of the earth,and the heavens are the work of Your hands. They will perish, but You remain; they will all wear out like a garment. You will roll them up like a robe; like a garment they will be changed. But You remain the same, and Your years will never end". (Hebrews 1:10-12) NIV
reflection: The author here has just quoted Psalms 102:25-27. When he speaks of the earth and the heavens rolled up like a garment, he is revealing that the earth is not permanent or indestructible. Jesus' authority is established over all of creation, so we dare not treat any created objects or earthly resources as more important than He is. So as we are coming to the close of 2006 let us resolve to put God first in our life.
prayer: Dear Lord, I have not lived this past year as I should have, often times I have put people and things ahead of You; forgive me Lord for my sin, and create in me a pure heart. Protect our troops in the coming days. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Offer someone today your shoulder to lean on

Our Meditation Today:
He also says, "In the beginning, O Lord, You laid the foundations of the earth,
and the heavens are the work of Your hands...

They will perish, but You remain; they will all wear out like a garment...

You will roll them up like a robe; like a garment they will be changed. But You
remain the same, and Your years will never end...(Heb. 1:10-12) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
The author here has just quoted Ps. 102:25-27...

When he speaks of the earth and the heavens rolled up like a garment, he is 
revealing that the earth is not permanent or indestructible...

Jesus' authority is established over all of creation, so we dare not treat any 
created objects or earthly resources as more important than He is...

So as we are coming to the close of 2006 let us resolve to put God first in
our life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I have not lived this past year as I should have, often
times I have put people and things ahead of You; forgive me Lord
for my sin, and create in me a pure heart...Protect our troops in the
coming days...Amen.

Keep looking up, He loves you and wants you as His child...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You will roll them up like a robe; like a garment they will be changed. But You (Christ) remain the same, and Your years will never end. (Hebrews 1:12) NIV
reflection: What does it mean that Christ is changeless ("You will remain the same")? It means that Christ's character will never change. He persistently shows His love to us. He is always fair, just, and merciful to us who are so undeserving. Be thankful that Christ is changeless; He will always help you when you need it and offer goodness when you fall.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for being changeless, in a world where nothing ever seems to remain the same. I thank You for Your grace and mercy which is new every day. Forgive me when I stumble along lives pathway. Help me to remain sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading, I pray these things in the name of Jesus. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Compliment three people today

Our Meditation for Today:
You will roll them up like a robe; like a garment they will be changed.
But You (Christ) remain the same, and Your years will never end...(Heb. 1:12) NIV 

Our Thought for Today:
What does it mean that Christ is changeless ("You will remain the same")?

It means that Christ's character will never change...He persistently shows 
His love to us...He is always fair, just, and merciful to us who are so undeserving.

Be thankful that Christ is changeless; He will always help you when you need it
and offer goodness when you fall...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for being changeless, in a world where
nothing ever seems to remain the same...I thank You for Your grace and 
mercy which is new every day...Forgive me when I stumble along lives pathway...Help me to remain sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading, I pray these 
things in the name of Jesus...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of to who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God also testified to it by signs, wonders, and various miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed according to His will. (Hebrews 2:4) NIV
reflection: "God testified to the message of salvation" this is a continuation of vs. 3. those who had heard Jesus speak and then has passed on His words also had the truth of their words confirmed by "signs and wonders and various miracles and by giving gifts of the Holy Spirit." In the book of Acts, miracles and gifts of the Spirit authenticated the Good News wherever it was preached (see Acts 9:31ff; 14:1ff). Paul who discussed spiritual gifts in Romans 12, I Corinthians 12-14 and Eph. 4, taught that their purpose is to build up the church, making it strong and mature. When this is fulfilled we know that God is truly present. As we receive God's gifts, we should thank Him for them and put them to use in the church.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the message of salvation, I pray that I would always be sensitive of my need of a Savior. I pray that I would use my gifts wisely to further Your kingdoms work. I pray this all in the name of Jesus. Amen.
original_content:

those who had heard Jesus speak and then has passed on His words also

In the book of Acts, miracles and gifts of the Spirit authenticated the Good

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You made Him a little lower than the angels; You crowned Him with glory and honor and put everything under His feet. In putting everything under Him, God left nothing that is not subject to Him. Yet at present we do not see everything subject to Him. (Hebrews 2:7, 8) NIV
reflection: Yes God has put Jesus in charge of everything, and Jesus revealed himself to us. We do not see Jesus reigning on earth as of yet, but we can picture Him in His heavenly glory. When you are confused by present events and anxious about the future, remember Jesus' true position and authority. He is Lord of all, and one day He will rule on earth as He now does in heaven. This truth can give stability to your decisions day by day.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not giving you the honor You so richly deserve. I long for the day that You will rule here on earth, and all will live in peace. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Over-tip the breakfast waitresses

Our Meditation for Today:
You made Him a little lower than the angels; You crowned Him with
glory and honor and put everything under His feet. In putting everything 
under Him, God left nothing that is not subject to Him. Yet at present we 
do not see everything subject to Him...(Heb. 2:7, 8) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
Yes God has put Jesus in charge of everything, and Jesus revealed himself to us.
We do not see Jesus reigning on earth as of yet, but we can picture Him in His
heavenly glory...

When you are confused by present events and anxious about the future, remember
Jesus' true position and authority. He is Lord of all, and one day He will rule on earth
as He now does in heaven...

This truth can give stability to your decisions day by day...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not giving you the honor You
so richly deserve. I long for the day that You will rule here on earth,
and all will live in peace...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you believe you will receive...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But we see Jesus who was a little lower than the angels, now crowned with glory and honor because He suffered death, so that by the grace of God He might taste death for everyone. (Hebrews 2:9) NIV
reflection: God's grace to us led Christ to His death. Jesus did not come into the world to gain status or political power, but to suffer and die that we could have eternal life. If it is difficult for us to identify with Christ's servant attitude, perhaps we need to evaluate our own motives. Are we more interested in power or participation, domination or service, getting or giving??? We need to make an honest effort to examine our motives.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for what Jesus did for me!!! I pray that my motives would be pure, so that my life would be truly lived in service to You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Have a firm hand shake...

Our Meditation for Today:
But we see Jesus who was a little lower than the angels, 
now crowned with glory and honor because He suffered
death, so that by the grace of God He might taste death
for everyone...(Heb. 2:9) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
God's grace to us led Christ to His death. Jesus did not come 
into the world to gain status or political power, but to suffer and 
die that we could have eternal life...

If it is difficult for us to identify with Christ's servant attitude, perhaps
we need to evaluate our own motives. Are we more interested in power 
or participation, domination or service, getting or giving???

We need to make an honest effort to examine our motives...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank You for what Jesus did for me!!!
I pray that my motives would be pure, so that my life
would be truly lived in service to You...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
